newsitem.title: USA: MEHL/Biophile says Palomar to drop suit.
newsitem.headline: MEHL/Biophile says Palomar to drop suit.

text.p: MEHL/Biophile International Corp said Tuesday Palomar Medical Technologies Inc has agreed to drop its lawsuit in Massachusetts to invalidate a patent for permanent laser hair removal exclusively licensed to its unit, Selvac Acquisition Corp.

MEHL/Biophile said Palomar's decision clears the way for MEHL's lawsuit in New Jersey alleging that the laser hair removal system made and distributed by Palomar and its subsidiary, Spectrum Medical Technologies Inc. infringes the patent, which is owned by Nardo Zaias.
MEHL said its suit against Palomar was filed on March 7, within a week of MEHL's receiving clearance from the Food and Drug Administration to sell its own laser system.
In addition to infringement of the Zaias patent, the New Jersey case alleges that Palomar and Spectrum illegally sold their laser hair removal system prior to receiving FDA market clearance.
A Palomar spokesman was not immediately available to comment.
